abstract: Medjugorje Journal; Vatican is expected to release findings of investigation into claims by six youths in Medjugorje, Bosnia and Herzegovina, in 1981 that Virgin Mary appeared to them, and continues to appear to at least three of the now-grown 'visionaries' every day; claims have made small town pilgrimage site; Pope Francis has expressed skepticism of phenomenon, and many residents fear ruling dismissing the claims could upend what has become a lucrative local industry.
lead_paragraph: Scheduled apparitions of the Virgin Mary in Medjugorje have drawn tens of millions of believers and suspicion from skeptics, including, perhaps, Pope Francis.

headline.main: Church Inquiry May Pit Pope Against a Popular Bosnian Shrine
headline.print_headline: Church Inquiry May Pit Pope Against a Popular Shrine

snippet: Scheduled apparitions of the Virgin Mary in Medjugorje have drawn tens of millions of believers and suspicion from skeptics, including, perhaps, Pope Francis.
